description: Demolition of the existing Public House and erection of a two and three storey development comprising 14 residential units with associated parking and landscaping
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings (4.1, B1, B5 and ES6). | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area. (4.5, B2, B16 and ES4). | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment and any security gates to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed before the development is first occupied.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter permanently retained.   REASON: To protect the amenity of the area (4.1, B1, B5, B8, ES5, ES6 and Supplementary Guidance 8). | Dustbin and enclosed refuse areas including recycling bins, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, shall be sited a maximum distance of 23 metres (10 metres where paladins are employed) from an adopted highway, and a maximum 25 metres from any dwelling unit intended to use them.  The refuse areas shall be implemented as approved prior to first occupation and permanently retained.  REASON: To comply with the Council's Design Guides (4.1, B1 and H34). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the plans, details of all external lighting to be erected, shall be in compliance with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers 'Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution' and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9, must be submitted in writing to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the development commencing.  The lighting as approved must be installed prior to the first occupation of the building and maintained in accordance with these standards thereafter.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area (4.12, B5 and B13). | Notwithstanding the information contained in the submitted plans, pedestrian and vehicular visibility splays consisting of 1.5m x 1.5m x 0.6m (h) shall be provided at the main entrance from Petts Hill fronting the site prior to first occupation of any of the proposed dwellings and thereafter permanently retained.   REASON:  To ensure highway safety (4.3, 9.1, B6, ES3, T62 and T63). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D and E of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no extensions or other alterations or porches or buildings or enclosures within the curtilage shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON: To prevent the over-development of the site and to safeguard the amenity of adjoining properties (4.1 and B1). | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards or the equivalent RSL standard, unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  REASON: To ensure access for all for future occupiers (5.3, H12 and H13). | Residential accommodation shall be constructed to include at least 10% of the units as wheelchair accessible, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  REASON: To ensure that an adequate proportion of units is wheelchair accessible (5.3, H12 and H13). | Details of a tree survey and method statement for measures to ensure full tree protection to BS 5837:1991 shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works on site.  The measures shall be implemented as approved and retained in accordance with the approved details.  REASON:  To prevent damage to the trees and in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area. (4.5 and B16). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the plans, the proposed windows at first floor and roof space of the south elevation directly facing the flank elevation of 216 Petts Hill shall be re-designed so that there will be no overlooking or loss of privacy to the occupiers of this property.  A model of the window design shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development, and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the model thus approved.  The details so approved shall be retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and to ensure that the elevational appearance is complimentary to the overall elevation design (5.1, 5.5, B1, B5). | Details of noise mitigation measures for the proposed residential development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the proposed development (5.1, 5.5, B1, B5). | Details of an Air Quality Study and requirements for mitigation ventilation shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development.  Any requirements for mitigation measures shall be implemented prior to first occupation and permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the site (5.1, 5.5, B1, B5). | The car parking spaces shown on the approved plan shall be marked out on site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.   REASON: To ensure adequate provision of car parking (T50, T63, 9.11). | Prior to commencement of works, details to prevent vehicular access and parking in rear gardens of proposed residential units and on land to the south-east of the proposed residential units shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation and permanently retained.  REASON: To ensure pedestrian and highway safety (9.1, 9.9, T56, T63). | No retained tree shall be cut down, uprooted or destroyed, nor shall any retained tree be topped or lopped other than in accordance with the approved plans and particulars, without the written approval of the local planning authority. Any topping or lopping approved shall be carried out in accordance with British Standard 3998 (Tree Work).  REASON: To prevent damage to the trees and in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area (4.5 and B16). | If any retained tree is removed, uprooted or destroyed or dies, another tree shall be planted at the same place and that tree shall be of such size and species, and shall be planted at such time, as may be specified in writing by the local planning authority.   REASON: To prevent damage to the trees and in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area (4.5 and B16). | The erection of fencing for the protection of any retained tree shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved plans and particulars before any equipment, machinery or materials are brought on to the site for the purposes of the development, and shall be maintained until all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site. Nothing shall be stored or placed in any area fenced in accordance with this condition and the ground levels within those areas shall not be altered, nor shall any excavation be made, without the written consent of the local planning authority.   REASON: To prevent damage to the trees and in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area (4.5 and B16).
